top_categories.workout_context: 340 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 340 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
340 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Iowa Wind and Rock's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
Iowa Wind and Rock's Iowa crushed limestone gravel roads, Rolling agricultural forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 340 miles.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 8,000ft of climbing on fast Iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation does to your power file on race day.
Iowa Wind and Rock's fast Iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
At Iowa Wind and Rock, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
8,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
8,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Iowa Wind and Rock. Train it until it feels boring.
Tempo is Iowa Wind and Rock's race pace. The wattage you'll hold for 340 miles on fast Iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation. Train it until it's automatic.

race_overlay.heat: April in Winterset, Iowa can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Iowa Wind and Rock. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 340 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 340 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Iowa Wind and Rock requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation to build confidence. Expect: iowa crushed limestone gravel roads, rolling agricultural land, river valley crossings.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Endurance, and HVLI Extended to prepare you for 340 miles of fast iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation in Winterset, Iowa.
